page.title: 18TURNERS'S HILL QUARRIES
page.content: There are several quarries around Turner's Hill, which have been or are still in use. Turner's Hill is a very prominant landmark in the local area, dominating the southern section of the block. It is part of the main watershed of England. The rock quarried from the ground is volcanic -dolerite- and is known locally as 'Rowley Rag'. It is used mainly for road making and is transported long distances to be used. Once the quarries have ceased to be used, they are filled with waste materials and finally landscaped. It is proposed by the local authority that one of the large quarries will still be used for the next 20 years and then it will take another 20 years for the reclaimation to be completed.
